newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Philips signs messaging deal with Motorola.
newsitem.headline: Philips signs messaging deal with Motorola.

text.p: Philips Electronics NV said on Friday it had signed a voice-mail cross-licensing deal with U.S telecoms equipment and semiconductors manufacturer Motorola.
No financial details were immediately available.

Philips said the deal would give it access to Motorola's full range of FLEX messaging technologies, enabling it to enter the U.S. pager market as well as extend its market share in Asia, where FLEX is widely used.
It said the deal was one component of its strategy to become a leading supplier of paging subscriber units.
Under the deal with Motorola, Philips Semiconductor Division will also become a supplier of integrated circuits for Motorala's flex technology, Philips said in a statement.
It said ReFLEX was the world's first two-way wireless system for transmitting and storing voice and data messages.
